update.description:
Issue #1418

* Links and joints appear when inserted

* Links and joints removed when deleted

* Double-clicking links or joints opens their inspectors

* Changing a joint's name on the inspector updates it on the tree

![tree1.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/4166606885-tree1.png)
update.title: Model Editor: Added a simple link/joint list to the palette

pull_request.title: Model Editor: Added a simple link/joint list to the palette

pullrequest.title: Model Editor: Added a simple link/joint list to the palette

content.raw: bit of a hackish thing to do: I deleted a joint's name in the joint inspector so that it's name was effectively "". In the palette joint list, the joint appears to disappear. The blank space for the joint name is still clickable though, and when you exit the model editor it renames the unnamed joint to `__default__`. However, if there are multiple joints set to unnamed, they all receive a name of `__default__`...
content.html: bit of a hackish thing to do: I deleted a joint's name in the joint inspector so that it's name was effectively "". In the palette joint list, the joint appears to disappear. The blank space for the joint name is still clickable though, and when you exit the model editor it renames the unnamed joint to __default__. However, if there are multiple joints set to unnamed, they all receive a name of __default__...

pullrequest.title: Model Editor: Added a simple link/joint list to the palette

content.raw:
I added a parameter to `jointInsert` which is a the unique Id besides the name, so the joint name can be passed without the need to strip `_HOTSPOT_` form it.

Also explicitly called the hotspot name a unique Id, as it is used to select joints with mouse clicks.

Links still work with names only for now, no "unique ids" since their names are not editable yet.

d80c239, 5581c15
content.html:
I added a parameter to jointInsert which is a the unique Id besides the name, so the joint name can be passed without the need to strip _HOTSPOT_ form it.

Also explicitly called the hotspot name a unique Id, as it is used to select joints with mouse clicks.

Links still work with names only for now, no "unique ids" since their names are not editable yet.

d80c239, 5581c15

content.raw:
I see. how about: 
~~~
jointNameChanged(const std::string &_oldName, const std::string &_newName)
jointInserted(const std::string &_name)
~~~

either this or having a unique id is fine.


I actually also created these events in a separate branch for the schematic view I am making. I also need two additional arguments for the `jointInserted` event for the link names. I'll add that after this pull request.
content.html:
I see. how about: 

jointNameChanged(const std::string &_oldName, const std::string &_newName)
jointInserted(const std::string &_name)

either this or having a unique id is fine.

I actually also created these events in a separate branch for the schematic view I am making. I also need two additional arguments for the jointInserted event for the link names. I'll add that after this pull request.

pull_request.title: Model Editor: Added a simple link/joint list to the palette

pullrequest.title: Model Editor: Added a simple link/joint list to the palette

content.raw: Similar to the previous comment, `_jointName` is being used here because that's the unique id to identify this joint inside `this->joints`.
content.html: Similar to the previous comment, _jointName is being used here because that's the unique id to identify this joint inside this->joints.

pull_request.title: Model Editor: Added a simple link/joint list to the palette

pullrequest.title: Model Editor: Added a simple link/joint list to the palette

content.raw:
I thought of using `hotSpotName` because it is the one used in `this->joints`. I'm treating it as a "unique id" for the joint, so below on `jointNameChanged`, both the hotspot name and the `_joint->name` are passed.

What do you think of passing both names to `jointInserted` as well? Then the hotspot name can be the `item->data(0, Qt::UserRole)` and the joint name goes in the text. (See [OnJointNameChanged](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1515/model-editor-added-a-simple-link-joint/diff#Lgazebo/gui/model/ModelEditorPalette.ccT538)).

We might also want to create a different unique id which has nothing to do with hotspot...
content.html:
I thought of using hotSpotName because it is the one used in this->joints. I'm treating it as a "unique id" for the joint, so below on jointNameChanged, both the hotspot name and the _joint->name are passed.

What do you think of passing both names to jointInserted as well? Then the hotspot name can be the item->data(0, Qt::UserRole) and the joint name goes in the text. (See OnJointNameChanged).

We might also want to create a different unique id which has nothing to do with hotspot...
